page.title: 02ABLINGTON
page.content:
On leaving Winson the Coln widens out and flows through the picturesque village of Ablington which has a wealth of old buildings. There is a fine l6.Century Elizabethan Manor House in the grounds of which there is a number of beautiful old trees, a l7. Century unspoilt farmhouse on whose gateposts stand two stone lions from the Houses of Parliament, splendid tithebarns and a number of ancient farms and cottages, most of which were built 200-300 years ago of the local stone.Unusually for a Cotswold village Ablington does not have a church; nor does it have any shops or other amenities. In the spring its river banks are covered with daffodils, and many townspeople and tourists come to admire its beauty.
.
